sentences.en: Are you ready? Off we go.
sentences.cn: 你准备好了吗？ 我们走吧。

sentences.en: Everyone got off the train at Winnipeg.
sentences.cn: 所有的人都在温尼伯下火车。

sentences.en: Four of them had gone off to find help.
sentences.cn: 他们中的4个人去寻求帮助了。

sentences.en: He got into his car and drove off.
sentences.cn: 他上了车，随即开车走了。

sentences.en: He took off at once and headed back to the motel.
sentences.cn: 他立刻离开，回到汽车旅馆。

sentences.en: Her husband was off on a business trip somewhere.
sentences.cn: 她丈夫到什么地方出差去了。

sentences.en: How are you off for sports equipment? (= do you have enough? )
sentences.cn: 你的体育运动装备够不够？

sentences.en: I feel it's done me good to get it off my chest.
sentences.cn: 我感觉吐吐苦水对我有好处。

sentences.en: I got a severe telling off for not phoning him.
sentences.cn: 我因为没给他打电话，被狠狠训斥了一顿。

sentences.en: I must be off now (= I must leave ).
sentences.cn: 现在我必须走了。

sentences.en: I pried the top off a can of chilli.
sentences.cn: 我揭开一罐辣椒的盖子。

sentences.en: I’ll get off at the next stop.
sentences.cn: 我将在下一站下车。

sentences.en: I'll make the tea and you pop off for a while.
sentences.cn: 我来备茶，你去歇一会儿吧。

sentences.en: Lights reflected off dust-covered walls creating a ghostly luminescence.
sentences.cn: 灯光照在满是灰尘的墙上，反射回苍白的冷光。

sentences.en: Locking up men does nothing more than keep them off the streets.
sentences.cn: 把这些人关起来只是做到了不让他们上街而已。

sentences.en: Make sure all the lights are off.
sentences.cn: 一定要把所有的灯都关掉。

sentences.en: Mitchel's schedule had not permitted him to take time off.
sentences.cn: 米切尔的日程安排使他无法休假。

sentences.en: Once we were off the main freeway, the trip felt more like a vacation.
sentences.cn: 我们一离开主高速公路，旅途的感觉就更像是度假了。

sentences.en: She went for a brisk walk to work off her frustration.
sentences.cn: 她快步走了一会儿，以排解心中的沮丧。

sentences.en: Suddenly they turned off and parked in a side road.
sentences.cn: 突然他们拐出去停在一条岔路上。

sentences.en: Take your coat off.
sentences.cn: 把你的外衣脱下来。

sentences.en: The areas are sealed off and ringed by troops.
sentences.cn: 这些地区被军队封锁包围了。

sentences.en: The film starts off realistically and then develops into a ridiculous fantasy.
sentences.cn: 电影以写实开头，然后却发展成为荒诞的幻想。

sentences.en: The lift started off, juddered, and went out of action.
sentences.cn: 电梯开动了，接着剧烈震颤起来，然后就毫无反应了。

sentences.en: They broke free and made off in a stolen car.
sentences.cn: 他们挣脱后开着一辆偷来的车逃之夭夭。

sentences.en: They were off to Italy (= leaving to go to Italy ) and wanted to make an early start.
sentences.cn: 他们要去意大利，想早点出发。

sentences.en: Today was really a bit of a write-off for me.
sentences.cn: 今天对我来说真的有点儿白白浪费了。

sentences.en: Will someone switch the radio off?
sentences.cn: 谁把收音机关掉好吗？

words.tran_cn: 冷漠的；不亲热的；疏远的

phrases.tran_cn: [英国俚语]从头开始；从起点开始，从一开始

trans.tran_cn: 不新鲜的，不能接受，不礼貌

trans.tran_en: used to say how much of something someone has
out of a bus, train, plane etc

trans.tran_cn: 从…落下，离开，从…去掉，下班
